title: Growing Code: Python Fundamentals
description: Discover Python's fundamental syntax and semantics through analyzing community garden data. In this introductory module, you will learn to write functions, handle user input, perform calculations, manage control flow (if/else), and utilize both iterative loops and recursionâ€”all within the context of sustainable gardening.

questions.q: In Exercise 1 (Garden Plot Area), the input() function returns a string. What function must be used to perform mathematical calculations on this input?
In Exercise 3 (Plant Age Check), which control flow statement allows the program to make a decision based on whether the age is greater than 60?
Exercise 5 requires implementing both an iterative and a recursive solution. What is the defining characteristic of the recursive function?
answers: It runs faster than the iterative version.

questions.q: In Exercise 7 (Seed Inventory), you are required to use type annotations. What is the correct syntax to declare that the 'quantity' parameter must be an integer?
According to the 'General Instructions' chapter, what should happen if a user enters a negative number or invalid input (unless explicitly handled)?
answers: The behavior is undefined (you don't need to handle it).
